text:
Dearâ€™s Chae-Ahâ€™s family,
I hope you are all doing well! First, I want to thank you for coming to the open class to watch Chae-Ah. I think she was really happy to show what she has learned and how well she is doing. She was talkative and using a loud voice, which sometimes was a struggle before. I was so happy she could be so confident in her abilities.
Chae-Ah is such a resilient girl. Even when sick, she wants to do her rest and doesnâ€™t want to take a break. I asked her if she wanted to rest or lay down, and she said no and kept doing her work even though her eyes kept closing. I am so proud she wants to do her best and work hard no matter what.
We have been working very heavily on irregular past tense verbs this month because they can be difficult to remember and actually use. There are a few that Chae-Ah remembers very well like â€œateâ€ and â€œwentâ€.
The spelling tests this month were a bit harder but they all did great, either missing none, or only missing 1 or 2!
Have a great weekend and rest well!
Bethany Teacher ğŸ˜Š
